sentences.en: I had thought it impolitic to smoke a cigar while pleading poverty.
sentences.cn: 我以前想,一面闹穷,一面又抽雪茄是失礼的.

sentences.en: It is impolitic to offend people who can help you.
sentences.cn: 触怒能帮助你的人是很失策的.

sentences.en: It might be impolitic to refuse his offer.
sentences.cn: 谢绝他的好意未免失策.

sentences.en: It was considered impolitic of him to spend too much time with the party radicals.
sentences.cn: 他花太多时间与党内的激进分子在一起，这被认为是不明智的。

sentences.en: It would have been impolitic to refuse his offer.
sentences.cn: 当时若拒绝了他的好意当然是不明智的。

trans.tran_cn: 不适当的，失策的，不可取的
trans.tran_en: behaving in a way that is not careful and that could make people think you are not sensible
